intro: Neurolaena balsana, commonly known as balsamroot or balsam weed, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant produces showy yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, giving them a fuzzy texture. Neurolaena balsana is often found in disturbed soils and can become invasive in certain regions.
